unnormalised: Alright folks, gather 'round! Ever feel like the world's a non-stop episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati, but instead of Amitabh Bachchan, it’s a hyperactive salesperson yelling about discounts? That’s the magic (and madness) of the flash sale!

unnormalised: These blink-and-you'll-miss-it events are basically a retail jalebi: sweet, tempting, and gone before you can say "Aloo Tikki." They’re like those fleeting Delhi winters – here one minute, sweltering summer the next.

unnormalised: Imagine this: It’s 2 PM on a Tuesday. You’re knee-deep in spreadsheets (thanks, accounting, thanks a LOT). Suddenly, your phone buzzes. "FLASH SALE! 80% off on sarees at SareeSansar! Valid for the next 2 hours only!" Your inner Chachi Ji wakes up with a vengeance. Suddenly, those Excel sheets look awfully… boring.

unnormalised: These are the questions that plague the soul during a flash sale. It’s a chaotic dance of desire and doubt. You frantically click, add to cart, then hesitate. unnormalised: Flash sales, my friends, are a roller coaster. Sometimes you score a designer kurta for Rs. 500 (score!), other times you end up with a hideous orange t-shirt that even the local dhobi refuses to touch (been there, done that). But hey, at least you got a story to tell, right? And maybe, just maybe, you got a fantastic deal. Until the next flash sale… the cycle continues!
